text.p: Consider the vector [mathjaxinline]v[/mathjaxinline] in [mathjaxinline]\mathbb R^2[/mathjaxinline] shown below.
Which of the following statements is true of the list [mathjaxinline]L = \{ v\}[/mathjaxinline]?

choice.text: [mathjaxinline]L[/mathjaxinline] is a basis of some subspace of [mathjaxinline]\mathbb R^2[/mathjaxinline], but not of [mathjaxinline]\mathbb R^2[/mathjaxinline] itself
[mathjaxinline]L[/mathjaxinline] is not a basis of any subspace of [mathjaxinline]\mathbb R^2[/mathjaxinline]

font.p: The list [mathjaxinline]L[/mathjaxinline] consists of a single vector in [mathjaxinline]\mathbb R^2[/mathjaxinline]. Thus, [mathjaxinline]L[/mathjaxinline] cannot be a basis of [mathjaxinline]\mathbb R^2[/mathjaxinline], since every such basis has exactly [mathjaxinline]2[/mathjaxinline] vectors.

Note that the list [mathjaxinline]L[/mathjaxinline] spans a line in [mathjaxinline]\mathbb R^2[/mathjaxinline], and [mathjaxinline]L[/mathjaxinline] is linearly independent, so [mathjaxinline]L[/mathjaxinline] forms a basis of that line.
